section.title: Introduction
section.p: You can use OPS to build standalone command-line applications running pipelines. Use cases include: creating a hardcopy of a web site, importing or exporting XML data to and from a relational database, testing pipelines, automating repetitive operations on XML files (selection, transformation, aggregation, etc.). OPS becomes your "XML toolbox".

Sometimes, it is better to group files under a resources sandbox addressed by the oxf: protocol. note.p: OPS's jar file (cli-ops.jar) is executable via the java -jar mechanism. However, it depends on a number of libraries that must be in the 'lib' directory beneath the directory containing cli-ops.jar. It is recommended to expand the WAR file, and refer to the cli-ops.jar file under the WAR file's WEB-INF directory.
